column2: Mostly good, but one significant con.
column3: Cons:- If you use a glass screen protector like most people, the front lip is too small/short, with a height difference less than the thickness of a credit card (i.e. if you lay a credit card flat on your screen, it'll be higher than the case's rim), so there's not really any protection from face drops.  It's fine if you put it face down on a perfectly flat and clean surface like a table - the screen doesn't touch anything.  But on an uneven surface like a sidewalk or a slightly textured wooden park bench table, or if there's a crumb slightly larger than a grain of sand, there's a high chance the screen will make contact.  Another 1-2mm of rim would be great.Meh:- Back's a bit of a fingerprint magnet.  Comes off with a quick wipe on your shirt/pants/whatever though.- Volume buttons could be a bit more separated to better differentiate them by feel when in your pocket.- Sides aren't super slick, but a bit more texture would be nice for gripPros:- Fits well.  Not so tight you're scared of bending/breaking your phone when taking it out, not so loose you're scared of it coming off in a fall.- Simple classy style.  Subtle branding on a small part of the edge.- Seems like decent (not crazy) drop protection on the sides and back.  Haven't had any notable drops though.- Opening around the lightning port is good sized - shouldn't have any issues with any plugs not fitting.  If anything, might be a tad too wide.

It was INCREDIBLY hard to take off, and I wanted to clean it often because it was easy to notice when it was dirty, but the more you took it off, the worse it fit your phone. It would get looser and looser. So after two months, I decided to get a new case. There are lots of highly rated clear cases on Amazon, but I found that some of them would trade gift cards for five star reviews. I’ve used Spigen before and knew I could trust the brand, and I ultimately settled on this one, and I’m so happy I did.I really like the bumpers on the corners of the phone. They’re not very noticeable of bulky. I also love the raised edge around the camera and the screen. I have a screen protector, but I like the extra security. This case is the perfect compromise between slim and protective.My only complaint is that there is text on three of the four sides. I really prefer a minimalist look, and I don’t mind having a little logo or brand name on one edge, but three seems excessive. However, once the case is on, its not as noticeable as you think.I would highly recommend this case to anyone who wants to show off their phone, but doesn’t want to compromise protection.

column3: Pros:- Inexpensive- Looks good- Camera protectedCons:- Inadequate protection for front screen- Extremely uncomfortable on the ear when taking phone calls- Difficult to find the edges of the screen protectorsI ordered this Spiegen case yesterday and it arrived this morning.  Thank goodness for speedy Amazon shipping.I have posted a video and a few pictures.  Apologies for the lack of quality in the video - it is the first unboxing one I made.The case came in a box in good condition.  The edges of the front and back protective films were difficult to find - it took a few minutes to find the edge - but once I found them the film came off easily.  As you can see in the video the case snapped on quickly and easily, even for someone doing it one-handed.  The photos show all the buttons and cutouts line up very well. The buttons have a nice click to them.  The cutout around the camera is well raised to protect the camera, and I was impressed with that.I am not so impressed for the protection for the front screen, however. I would prefer the lip raised a little more to provide greater protection.  It is extremely minimal and frankly I am sure will provide zero protection for the front of the phone should it fall.The case looks good and shows off the colour of the phone...I'm just extremely skeptical about how much protection it will practically provide.Just before I posted this review I received a phone call and I'm so glad I did as I was able to feel the comfort of the case up against my ear.  YIKES.  The edge is extremely uncomfortable and hurt my ear.  I ended up having to hold the phone away from my ear because it was painful.I can't speak to yellowing, of course, as I've had it in my possession for all of 30 minutes.
